remarks: This lemma is used to prove that there exists x as in Lemma 1 of [BrosowskiDeutsh] p. 90: 0 <= x(t) <= 1 for all t in T, x(t) < epsilon for all t in V, x(t) > 1 - epsilon for all t in T \ U. Here we prove the very last step of the proof of Lemma 1:  "The result follows from taking x = 1 - q_n".  Here ` E ` is used to represent ε in the paper, and ` y ` to represent q_n in the paper.  (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 20-Apr-2017.)
statement:

stoweidlem41.3 $e |- F = ( t e. T |-> 1 ) $.
stoweidlem41.4 $e |- V C_ T $.

stoweidlem41.7 $e |- ( ( ph /\ f e. A ) -> f : T --> RR ) $.
stoweidlem41.8 $e |- ( ( ph /\ f e. A /\ g e. A ) -> ( t e. T |-> ( ( f ` t ) + ( g ` t ) ) ) e. A ) $.
stoweidlem41.9 $e |- ( ( ph /\ f e. A /\ g e. A ) -> ( t e. T |-> ( ( f ` t ) x. ( g ` t ) ) ) e. A ) $.
stoweidlem41.10 $e |- ( ( ph /\ w e. RR ) -> ( t e. T |-> w ) e. A ) $.
stoweidlem41.11 $e |- ( ph -> E e. RR+ ) $.
stoweidlem41.12 $e |- ( ph -> A. t e. T ( 0 <_ ( y ` t ) /\ ( y ` t ) <_ 1 ) ) $.
stoweidlem41.13 $e |- ( ph -> A. t e. V ( 1 - E ) < ( y ` t ) ) $.
stoweidlem41.14 $e |- ( ph -> A. t e. ( T \ U ) ( y ` t ) < E ) $.
stoweidlem41 $p |- ( ph -> E. x e. A ( A. t e. T ( 0 <_ ( x ` t ) /\ ( x ` t ) <_ 1 ) /\ A. t e. V ( x ` t ) < E /\ A. t e. ( T \ U ) ( 1 - E ) < ( x ` t ) ) ) $.
